metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1550 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the MediaInputPort class in Mozilla Firefox before 31.0 and Thunderbird before 31.0 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (heap memory corruption) by leveraging incorrect Web Audio control-message ordering.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1550` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:31.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
